Articles.Content:
So, in my new carrier my ships just don't want to lift off. After ignition they just sit on the pad or release from the launch tower and slowly drift at 0.2 m/s up. hacking gravity does not work, infinite fuel an a loooong burn doesn't work, side facing SRB to wiggle the rocket free doesn't work. The only thing that does work is staging. 

Now, I've got a ton of mods and before i start plucking them out one by one I was wondering if anyone has encountered something like this.

Here is my mod list.

 

Edited May 15, 2016 by Mighty1

Are you sure you don't have a launch clamp that's in a future stage? Sometimes KSP doesn't know where to put some parts in the staging sequence.

Edited May 15, 2016 by WillThe84th
Try installing latest version of FAR.
Pictures of what you're trying to do?

I'll post a picture in the evening , 16 hours from now

EDIT: 16 hours have passed and here is the screenshot. Note that the SRB is at 100% power, TWR is 1.55, fuel is being consumed, the mission clock is NOT ticking (just noticed that). I'll start removing mods now 1 by 1. If anyone has an idea what can be the problem tell me to save some time. I will report on the progress.

Edit #2 @MatterBeam was correct, it was FAR.

Edited May 16, 2016 by Mighty1
TWR of 1.55 is rather weak.  I always have initial TWR of >2.0
